intro: Clematis stella, commonly known as the Star Clematis, is a deciduous vine native to Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has compound leaves with three to five leaflets, and its stems are covered in fine, rusty-colored hairs. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and requires well-drained soil. Clematis stella is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a climbing plant.
